author: epagltd
title: Anti-counterfeit B2B ecosyst Africa
description: ケニアのIIIegal goodsは2018年に@USD8.26Billionと推定される。このうち23.37%が建築・鉱業・建設業である。アフリカの方が大きい。

f6_assessments.q0: The project will create a Business 2 Business web application and onboard business in Kenya. This has the potential to reduce the counterfeit and role of middlemen and bring transparency. The same applies if open source can be scaled up to many industries. Therefore there is a need to support these initiatives and produce quality applications for entrepreneurs to take advantage of.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer claims 10 years of experience in the management of construction projects and will be assisted by an ICT project manager who has been identified as a technical head. Their project has to be developed and more importantly adopted. Adoption is a major risk and with the proposer's experience and a clear and achievable aim to onboard 3 manufacturers and 3 retailers, the proposer seems to be aware of the market well. Any reference to his past work would have added value to the proposal. However, the proposal on its own merit stands.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal aims to build the software within three months and onboard 9 entitled for beta testing in Phase 1. The fund requirement is 65K USD. The 10K for project management may be on the higher side considering the allotment of 10K for the blockchain development. There is a need for clarity in the estimation of development cost and in identifying the developers who will work on the project. With this, the output and success of the project will be measurable.

f6_assessments.q0: An african B2B marketplace that will make sure no counterfits would be sold. The problem fits with the challege setting, since a platform would be made using the mean stack. This will surely add value to the cardano ecosystem and to the businesses in africa strugling with counterfit unverified documents. The key metrics are in line with the end goal of the proposal. I don't know about scaling since no specific team or necessary skills are mentioned apart from the mean stack. I'm missing a bit of detail when it comes to the budget and possible team to get the work done. Compared to other proposals this one sure is more impactful than most. As a developer I'm a bit woried about the lack of technical people on the team right now, because I think they're not approached yet or assembled.
f6_assessments.q1: No references are provided by the business entrepreneur from Kenya. No linkedin links no credentials that could be verified so that doesn't seem very transparent and tracable. The lack of specific team members and links brings the credibility of the whole project IMO. It seems the proposer has some idea of the skillset that will be required for the implementation of the project, but no team is assembled which might drag the project down the line. The budget is broken down, but it's very coarce IMO. I don't see any reasoning behind most of the listed costs. Marketing could be 1300$ for google adds to 30k, and without the rationale provided I'm not sure if the cost is relevant or not. As a developer the timetable seems realistic to me only if there is already a team assembled and by reading the proposal for the second time I don't see that being the case. There is some plan for implementation, but again more details are needed for me because as it stands now, I can't be sure if the project is feasible or not.  The finantial and legal aspects of the proposal seem very well described, but this level of detail is lacking in other places in the proposal.   Overall I didn't find enough information to positively say if this project would be feasible or not.
f6_assessments.q2: I didn't see a way for a community member to track and follow along with the project development so auditability for the project might be difficult. The metrics seem ok for the end goal, but don't help with auditability. I'd suggest listing a telegram or a discord channel to send news to interested members. Theres a good roadmap that has the main milestones set. The description of the problem and solution is clearly stated.   Overall I think it will be hard for a regular cardano voter to follow along and audit the work being done.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal seem to specifically address the problem of counterfeiting and tracking of goods from the manufacturers to the consumer. It is a proposal that has the potential to expand the adoption of the cardano ecosystem and it aligns with the challenge brief to endger the expansion dapps ecosystem's use cases
f6_assessments.q1:
From the information, the team has not presented enough information to show the level of skill and capacity needed to successfully implement this project.
 
The budget details are vague  and not well articulated, considering the amount requested.

Irrespective of the proposal's details including the roadmaps, it all seems very academic with so many functionalities that make the initial primary problem statement look trivial and secondary. 

In addition, there is no mention of any potential risk factors Like laws and regulations, acceptance etc. that  might derail the project success.

This inclusion of these potential challenges would have added much need confidence on the proposal's implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has not provided reasonable success metric to assess and monitor the project's performance if funded.

solution: 完全に安全なサプライチェーンシステムブロックチェーンB2B markekplaceを開発し、銀行がエンドユーザーに合法的に製品のみのADA支払いを行う。
experience: 私は、ケニアで銀行が融資した住宅建設プロジェクトを管理した10年の銀行経験があります。私は価格カルテルを見てきました。
